page.title: 04A MIXED FARM-continuation p3
page.content: Most of Ludney Farm has been in the family for 300 years,they bought more land 43 years ago to enlarge the farm. All of the family works on the farm.They like farming because there is so much variety,they especially enjoy the baby animals.The family has decided to keep the hedges around the farm and not to rip them out.They do use modern equipment though,they have a combine harvester;8 tractors;an industrial digger and a potato harvester.They use about 120 tons of fertiliser per year. The EEC dairy quotas have not really affected them,because they decided to cut down on 'quality foods'instead,if they had not cut down they would have had to 'lose' 10 cows.At the moment they produce 516884 litres of milk per year.
